key_points: Vice President Kamala Harris' approval rating falls to 28%, a historic low for any modern vice president according to a new USA Today/Suffolk University poll.
President Joe Biden's approval rating has also hit a new low at 38%.
A majority of 51% of respondents disapprove of the job Harris is doing as VP.
This early in a modern presidency, Harris' approval rating is unprecedentedly low.
Former Vice President Dick Cheney, previously the most unpopular US vice president with a low of 30%, is slightly less unpopular than Harris at the same point in his tenure.
Harris has been tasked with challenging assignments, including managing the migration surge of asylum seekers at the southern border.
Aides to Harris are reportedly concerned about the 2024 presidential election and potential competition from Pete Buttigieg.
The poll included a sample of 1,000 registered voters nationwide.
The margin of error for the poll is plus or minus 3.1 percentage points.
The poll's results were published in a story by Business Insider, available exclusively to its subscribers.
